item.title: Flynas is using Virus Guard to combat MERS and Ebola
item.description:
Flynas, a Saudi Arabian low-cost airline, has incorporated Virus Guard disinfectant wipes and sprays into its in-flight hygiene procedures. Given the concerning rise of MERS cases in the region, with over a thousand reported so far, Flynas aims to prioritize the health of both travelers and staff by mitigating the risk of viral transmission. Eman Yusuf, Flynas’ In-flight Services and On-board Product Manager, stated that the airline will utilize these specialized wipes and sprays to disinfect all frequently touched surfaces within the aircraft...

item.title: INTERPOL warns against Simda, urges PC owners to conduct scans on their devices
item.description:
A global operation based out of INTERPOL’s Global Complex for Innovation in Singapore recently disrupted the Simda botnet, which is estimated to have compromised over 770,000 computers globally. Cybercriminals used Simda to gain unauthorized access to computers, enabling them to steal sensitive data like banking credentials and spread additional malicious software. Simda, active over several years, had become increasingly sophisticated. New, harder-to-detect versions were being created and disseminated every few hours...

item.title: The launch of ESET Smart Security 9 and ESET NOD32 Antivirus 9 has been announced
item.description:
ESET, a global cybersecurity company, has launched ESET Smart Security 9 and ESET NOD32 Antivirus 9. These releases feature a redesigned user interface and enhanced security features. Parvinder Walia, ESET’s Asia Pacific Sales and Marketing Director, highlighted the Asia-Pacific region’s rapid growth in internet and mobile usage, leading to increased adoption of online and mobile banking. He emphasized that the new banking and payment protection in ESET Smart Security 9 will allow customers to conduct secure financial transactions online...
